Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Sun-Dot’ delivers an explosion of classic, balanced tomato flavour: a bright, tangy sweetness with low acidity and a rich, aromatic finish. The fruits are 2-3 cm in diameter, with a firm, glossy skin that gives way to a juicy, seed-filled interior. The plant itself is a compact, bushy powerhouse, rarely exceeding 40 cm in height and width, making it an ideal candidate for pots and fabric towers.

2. The Ultimate Snacking Tomato This tomato’s perfect balance of sweetness and tang makes it incredibly versatile, but it truly shines in its simplest forms.

  • Fresh Off the Vine: The ultimate garden snack. Their firm texture and burst-in-your-mouth juiciness make them irresistible for fresh eating.
  • Salads & Skewers: Whole or halved, they add vibrant colour and a sweet-tart pop to salads, caprese skewers, and grain bowls.
  • Concentrated Sauces: Due to their high brix (sugar content) and balanced acidity, ‘Sun-Dot’ tomatoes cook down into an intensely flavoured, sweet and rich pasta sauce or soup base.
  • Quick-Pickled Treat: Their firm skin holds up beautifully to quick-pickling in a sweet brine, creating a delightful refrigerator pickle.

3. The Harvest and Yield As a determinate variety, ‘Sun-Dot’ sets and ripens its fruit in a generous, synchronized wave over a 2-3 week period. This makes it perfect for a planned harvest. Supplied as an RFID-tagged seedling plug, a single plant provides a bountiful, one-time yield of 1.5–2 kg of flawless, sun-ripened cherries, with the entire crop ready for harvest just 60 days from transplant.
